messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/v1/posts/{post}` with method DELETE, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, `PostController` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/posts/{post}` with HTTP method DELETE.

2. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@destroy` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/posts/{post}` with HTTP method DELETE.

3. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@show` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/posts/{post}` with HTTP method DELETE.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Explanation:

- The DELETE endpoint is defined by Route::apiResource('posts', PostController::class)->only(['update', 'store', 'destroy']) inside the v1 API group (routes/api.php). That maps the DELETE request to /v1/posts/{post} to App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostController@destroy (file provided).
- The controller destroy(Post $post) receives a route model bound Post instance. Route-model binding key is determined by Post::getRouteKeyName(). In App\Models\Post::getRouteKeyName() the code returns 'id' when the request expects JSON (API routes), so the route parameter corresponds to the post numeric id.
- The posts table migration defines id as an auto-increment integer (increments), so the path parameter 'post' is an integer (format int32).
- Path parameters in Swagger 2.0 must be required and have in="path". The only parameter for this endpoint is the post identifier.

the final generated result begins
[
  {
    "name": "post",
    "in": "path",
    "description": "ID of the post to delete",
    "required": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "format": "int32"
  }
]
